page.title: 08Housework in 1985
page.content: We interviewed thirteen housewives about{housework.}We found{61%}of them did{not like it.}We found that{61%}of housewives{had help with housework. They were mainly helped in washing up and cleaning windows. The jobs people did{not mind}doing were{washing {clothes, dusting}and{hoovering.}One job that someone especially liked was {cleaning brasses.}The{most unpopular job was{ironing. 76%}of people said this was the{worst task.}Most people spend between{2 and 4 hours a day doing housework. We asked if people had any tips about housework. Mrs. Jones said you can clean tap drip marks off the bath by using lemon juice. Mrs. Whitworth suggested that windows be cleaned with wet newspaper and then wiped with a duster. Mrs. Atkins told us you can stop condensat- ion on a mirror by putting soap on it.
